csharp_simple:
1using System;
2using System.Collections.Generic;
3​
4namespace TechnicalIndicators
5{
6 /// <summary>
7 /// Elder Ray Index
8 /// </summary>
9 /// <remarks>
10 /// developed by Alexander Elder to measure buying and selling pressure.
11 /// <list type="bullet">
12 /// <item><description>Bull Power = High - EMA(Close)</description></item>
13 /// <item><description>Bear Power = Low - EMA(Close)</description></item>
14 /// </list>
15 /// </remarks>
16 public class ElderRay
17 {
18 public int Period { get; }
19 public List<decimal?> BullPower { get; } = new();
20 public List<decimal?> BearPower { get; } = new();
21​
22 public ElderRay(int period = 13)
23 {
24 Period = period;
25 }
26​
27 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
28 {
29 BullPower.Clear(); BearPower.Clear();
30 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
31 if (candleList.Count == 0) return;
32​
33 // Step 1: Calculate EMA (Baseline)
34 var emaValues = new List<decimal?>();
35 decimal k = 2.0m / (Period + 1);
36​
37 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
38 {
39 if (i < Period - 1)
40 {
41 emaValues.Add(null);
42 BullPower.Add(null);
43 BearPower.Add(null);
44 continue;
45 }
46​
47 if (i == Period - 1)
48 {
49 decimal sum = 0;
50 for (int j = 0; j < Period; j++) sum += candleList[i - j].Close;
51 emaValues.Add(sum / Period);
52 }
53 else
54 {
55 decimal? prev = emaValues[i - 1];
56 if (prev.HasValue)
57 emaValues.Add((candleList[i].Close - prev.Value) * k + prev.Value);
58 else
59 emaValues.Add(null);
60 }
61​
62 // Step 2: Calculate Powers
63 if (emaValues[i].HasValue)
64 {
65 BullPower.Add(candleList[i].High - emaValues[i].Value);
66 BearPower.Add(candleList[i].Low - emaValues[i].Value);
67 }
68 else
69 {
70 BullPower.Add(null);
71 BearPower.Add(null);
72 }
73 }
74 }
75​
76 public static (List<decimal?> bull, List<decimal?> bear) Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int period = 13)
77 {
78 var er = new ElderRay(period);
79 er.Calculate(candles);
80 return (er.BullPower, er.BearPower);
81 }
82 }
83}
csharp_detailed:
1// =============================================================================
2// Logic Breakdown (ElderRay)
3// =============================================================================
4//
5// This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6// Elder Ray Index technical indicator.
7// We explain *why* code is written this way and *how* data transforms
8// line-by-line, targeting programming beginners.
9//
10// [Core Concepts]
11//
12// 1. X-Raying the Market
13// [Why] Dr. Alexander Elder wanted to "see through" the market surface to
14// measure the underlying strength of Bulls and Bears.
15// [What] He defined the "Value" (Consensus) as the EMA.
16// - Prices above EMA = Bullish Power.
17// - Prices below EMA = Bearish Power.
18//
19// 2. Highs and Lows
20// [Bull Power] Measures the ability of buyers to lift prices above the average.
21// Formula: High - EMA
22// [Bear Power] Measures the ability of sellers to push prices below the average.
23// Formula: Low - EMA
24//
25// [Visual Plan]
26// EMA Line: The central axis (Consensus Value).
27// Bull Pwr: The distance from the Daily High to the EMA.
28// Bear Pwr: The distance from the Daily Low to the EMA.
29// Interpretation:
30// - Bull Power is usually positive.
31// - Bear Power is usually negative.
32//
33// =============================================================================
34​
35using System;
36using System.Collections.Generic;
37​
38namespace TechnicalIndicators
39{
40 // =============================================================================
41 // Logic Explanation: OHLCV Data Container
42 // =============================================================================
43 public readonly record struct CandleData(DateTime Timestamp, decimal Open, decimal High, decimal Low, decimal Close, long Volume);
44​
45 // =============================================================================
46 // Logic Explanation: Elder Ray Index Class
47 //
48 // [Why] Outputs two separate lists: BullPower and BearPower.
49 // Calculated simultaneously as they share the same EMA.
50 // =============================================================================
51 public class ElderRay
52 {
53 // -------------------------------------------------------------
54 // Logic Explanation: Configuration
55 // -------------------------------------------------------------
56 public int Period { get; }
57 public List<decimal?> BullPower { get; } = new();
58 public List<decimal?> BearPower { get; } = new();
59​
60 // =============================================================================
61 // Logic Explanation: Constructor
62 // =============================================================================
63 public ElderRay(int period = 13)
64 {
65 if (period <= 0)
66 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException(nameof(period));
67 Period = period;
68 }
69​
70 // =============================================================================
71 // Logic Explanation: Main Calculation Method
72 // =============================================================================
73 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
74 {
75 // -------------------------------------------------------------
76 // Step 1: Cleanup & Setup
77 // -------------------------------------------------------------
78 BullPower.Clear();
79 BearPower.Clear();
80 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
81 if (candleList.Count == 0) return;
82​
83 // -------------------------------------------------------------
84 // Step 2: EMA Calculation + Power Derivation
85 //
86 // [Why] (Efficient)
87 // Instead of calculating the entire EMA list first and then iterating
88 // again to subtract from High/Low, we do it in a single pass
89 // as we calculate the EMA.
90 // -------------------------------------------------------------
91 var emaValues = new List<decimal?>();
92 decimal k = 2.0m / (Period + 1);
93​
94 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
95 {
96 // -------------------------------------------------------------
97 // Phase A: Insufficient Data (Warm-up)
98 // -------------------------------------------------------------
99 if (i < Period - 1)
100 {
101 emaValues.Add(null);
102 BullPower.Add(null);
103 BearPower.Add(null);
104 continue;
105 }
106​
107 // -------------------------------------------------------------
108 // Phase B: Bootstrap (First Valid EMA)
109 //
110 // [Why] Standard EMA convention: Start with SMA of first 'Period' bars.
111 // -------------------------------------------------------------
112 if (i == Period - 1)
113 {
114 decimal sum = 0;
115 for (int j = 0; j < Period; j++) sum += candleList[i - j].Close;
116
117 decimal sma = sum / Period;
118 emaValues.Add(sma);
119 }
120 // -------------------------------------------------------------
121 // Phase C: Recursive EMA
122 // -------------------------------------------------------------
123 else
124 {
125 decimal? prev = emaValues[i - 1];
126 if (prev.HasValue)
127 {
128 decimal ema = (candleList[i].Close - prev.Value) * k + prev.Value;
129 emaValues.Add(ema);
130 }
131 else
132 {
133 emaValues.Add(null); // Should not happen after bootstrap
134 }
135 }
136​
137 // -------------------------------------------------------------
138 // Step 3: Calculate Powers
139 //
140 // [Formula]
141 // Bull = High - EMA
142 // Bear = Low - EMA
143 // -------------------------------------------------------------
144 if (emaValues[i].HasValue)
145 {
146 BullPower.Add(candleList[i].High - emaValues[i].Value);
147 BearPower.Add(candleList[i].Low - emaValues[i].Value);
148 }
149 else
150 {
151 BullPower.Add(null);
152 BearPower.Add(null);
153 }
154 }
155 }
156​
157 // =============================================================================
158 // Logic Explanation: Static Convenience Wrapper
159 // =============================================================================
160 public static (List<decimal?> bull, List<decimal?> bear) Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int period = 13)
161 {
162 var er = new ElderRay(period);
163 er.Calculate(candles);
164 return (er.BullPower, er.BearPower);
165 }
166 }
167}
python_simple:
1class ElderRay:
2 """
3 Elder Ray
4 Bull Power = High - EMA(Median?)
5 Wait, Standard is High - EMA(Close).
6 C# code used EMA(Close).
7 """
8 def __init__(self, period=13):
9 self.period = period
10 self.bull_power = []
11 self.bear_power = []
12​
13 def calculate(self, candles):
14 self.bull_power.clear()
15 self.bear_power.clear()
16
17 if len(candles) == 0: return
18​
19 # 1. EMA
20 ema = self._calculate_ema(candles, self.period)
21
22 # 2. Powers
23 for i in range(len(candles)):
24 if ema[i] is None:
25 self.bull_power.append(None)
26 self.bear_power.append(None)
27 else:
28 self.bull_power.append(candles[i]['high'] - ema[i])
29 self.bear_power.append(candles[i]['low'] - ema[i])
30​
31 def _calculate_ema(self, candles, period):
32 results = []
33 if len(candles) == 0: return results
34
35 k = 2.0 / (period + 1)
36 prev = None
37
38 for i in range(len(candles)):
39 if i < period - 1:
40 results.append(None)
41 continue
42
43 if i == period - 1:
44 s = sum(c['close'] for c in candles[i-period+1:i+1])
45 prev = s / period
46 results.append(prev)
47 continue
48
49 if prev is not None:
50 # Recursion
51 val = (candles[i]['close'] - prev) * k + prev
52 results.append(val)
53 prev = val
54 else:
55 results.append(None)
56 return results
57​
58def calculate(candles, period=13):
59 er = ElderRay(period)
60 er.calculate(candles)
61 return er.bull_power, er.bear_power
python_detailed:
1# =============================================================================
2# Logic Breakdown (ElderRay)
3# =============================================================================
4#
5# This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6# Elder-Ray Index (Bull Power & Bear Power). We explain *why* code is written
7# this way and *how* data transforms line-by-line, targeting programming beginners.
8#
9# [Core Concepts]
10# 1. X-Ray of the Market
11# Alexander Elder designed this to see "inside" the market structure.
12# It compares the raw price extremes (High/Low) to the consensus of value (EMA).
13#
14# 2. Bull Power
15# The ability of buyers to push prices ABOVE the average.
16# Formula: High - EMA
17# - Usually positive.
18# - If High < EMA, bulls are extremely weak (negative power).
19#
20# 3. Bear Power
21# The ability of sellers to push prices BELOW the average.
22# Formula: Low - EMA
23# - Usually negative.
24# - If Low > EMA, bears are extremely weak (positive power).
25#
26# =============================================================================
27​
28​
29# -------------------------------------------------------------
30# Type-Level Explanation: ElderRay (class)
31#
32# [Why] Outputting multiple values (Bull & Bear) requires state management.
33# [What] Computes buying/selling pressure relative to trend.
34# [How] Calculates an EMA (consensus of value) and compares it to the High (Bull Power) and Low (Bear Power) of the price to determine market strength.
35# [Who] Reversal traders.
36# [Where] Heap allocation.
37# -------------------------------------------------------------
38class ElderRay:
39​
40 # -------------------------------------------------------------
41 # Constructor: __init__
42 #
43 # [Why] Configure the baseline trend period.
44 # [What] Standard period is 13 (usually EMA-13).
45 # -------------------------------------------------------------
46 def __init__(self, period=13):
47 # -------------------------------------------------------------
48 # Logic Step 1: Validation
49 # -------------------------------------------------------------
50 if period <= 0:
51 raise ValueError("period")
52 self.period = period
53 self.bull_power = []
54 self.bear_power = []
55​
56​
57 # =============================================================================
58 # IPO: calculate
59 # =============================================================================
60 #
61 # [Input]
62 # - candles: list[dict]
63 #
64 # [Process]
65 # 1. Calculate EMA (the baseline/consensus).
66 # 2. BullPower = CurrentHigh - EMA.
67 # 3. BearPower = CurrentLow - EMA.
68 #
69 # [Output]
70 # - None (populates bull_power, bear_power).
71 # =============================================================================
72 def calculate(self, candles):
73
74 # -------------------------------------------------------------
75 # Logic Step 1: Reset & Guard
76 # -------------------------------------------------------------
77 self.bull_power.clear()
78 self.bear_power.clear()
79 if len(candles) == 0:
80 return
81​
82 # -------------------------------------------------------------
83 # Logic Step 2: Main Loop (Combined EMA + Power Calc)
84 #
85 # [Why] (Efficiency)
86 # We can calculate EMA and Powers in a single pass O(N).
87 # Independent double-loops would be inefficient (O(2N)).
88 # -------------------------------------------------------------
89 ema_values = []
90 k = 2.0 / (self.period + 1)
91​
92 for i in range(len(candles)):
93
94 # -------------------------------------------------------------
95 # Logic Step 2.1: EMA Calculation
96 #
97 # [Visual]
98 # Standard Recursive EMA Logic.
99 # -------------------------------------------------------------
100 current_ema = None
101
102 if i < self.period - 1:
103 ema_values.append(None) # Not enough data
104 elif i == self.period - 1:
105 # Seed (SMA)
106 s = sum(candles[i - j]['close'] for j in range(self.period))
107 current_ema = s / self.period
108 ema_values.append(current_ema)
109 else:
110 # Recursive EMA
111 prev = ema_values[i - 1]
112 if prev is not None:
113 current_ema = (candles[i]['close'] - prev) * k + prev
114 ema_values.append(current_ema)
115 else:
116 ema_values.append(None)
117​
118 # -------------------------------------------------------------
119 # Logic Step 2.2: Power Calculation
120 #
121 # [Visual]
122 # EMA = 100
123 # Candle: High=105, Low=95
124 # BullPower = 105 - 100 = +5 (Bulls pushed 5 pts above avg)
125 # BearPower = 95 - 100 = -5 (Bears pushed 5 pts below avg)
126 # -------------------------------------------------------------
127
128 # Need a valid EMA to compute power
129 # [Decision] Do we have a baseline?
130 if current_ema is not None:
131 self.bull_power.append(candles[i]['high'] - current_ema)
132 self.bear_power.append(candles[i]['low'] - current_ema)
133 else:
134 # Fill gaps
135 self.bull_power.append(None)
136 self.bear_power.append(None)
137​
138​
139# =============================================================================
140# Static Wrapper Function
141# =============================================================================
142#
143# [Why]
144# Functional interface.
145#
146# [Pattern: 3-Step Static Wrapper]
147# =============================================================================
148def calculate(candles, period=13):
149 # 1. Instantiation
150 er = ElderRay(period)
151
152 # 2. Execution
153 er.calculate(candles)
154
155 # 3. Extraction
156 return er.bull_power, er.bear_power
